title: Sustainability Metrics
text:
R Chunk
Let’s test out how an R chunk goes.


Code
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess")








Figure 1: Temperature and ozone level.

title: Sustainability Metrics
text:
Second Header
Note that the engine will automatically be knitr (R) if there are ONLY R chunks in the doc. If there are both python and R chunks, it will use reticulate. In this case, you must NOT set the engine in the YAML header. Just leave it blank, and you can run both R and python together.

title: Environment
text:
Code
suppressPackageStartupMessages(
    pacman::p_load(
        ggplot2,
        janitor,
        dplyr
    )
)

data(iris)
dat <- iris %>%
    clean_names()
dat %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = sepal_length, y = petal_length, color = species)) +
    geom_jitter(
        size = 3,
        alpha = 0.6
    ) +
    theme_classic()

title: Environment
text:

suppressPackageStartupMessages(
    pacman::p_load(
        ggplot2,
        janitor,
        dplyr
    )
)

data(iris)
dat <- iris %>%
    clean_names()
dat %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x = sepal_length, y = petal_length, color = species)) +
    geom_jitter(
        size = 3,
        alpha = 0.6
    ) +
    theme_classic()

title: Framework

Tree





Code
import sys
print(sys.prefix)
print(sys.version)


C:\Users\cdonov12\AppData\Local\R-MINI~1\envs\myenv
3.12.6 | packaged by conda-forge | (main, Sep 30 2024, 17:48:58) [MSC v.1941 64 bit (AMD64)]


This should show the environment


Code
import sys
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis
